feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP RAP Application – Data Not Inserting into Custom Tables (First RAP Project)
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am currently working on my first SAP RAP application in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and I need guidance from experienced RAP developers.

Business Requirement

Create an Excel uploader to update Bank Details for Vendor/Customer master data.

What I Have Implemented So Far

I followed the standard RAP development steps:

  1. Created Custom Persistent Tables and Draft Tables

  2. Created Interface CDS View

  3. Created Consumption CDS View

  4. Added Metadata Extensions for UI

  5. Defined Behavior Definitions for Interface and Consumption Views

  6. Implemented Behavior Handler Classes

  7. Created Service Definition

  8. Created Service Binding

Current Issue

  • I am successfully reading Excel data and storing it into an internal table in the behavior implementation class.

  • However, when I try to insert this data into my custom item table, no data is getting persisted in the database.

  • There are no syntax errors, but the records are not saved.

My Doubt / Confusion

Since this is my first RAP project, I am not sure:

  • Whether I am inserting data in the correct RAP lifecycle method

  • If I should use MODIFY ENTITIES instead of direct INSERT

  • If the issue is related to managed behavior, draft handling, or association (_item) handling

  • Or if my behavior definition and class implementation are not aligned

Request for Help

I would really appreciate if someone could:

  • Review my approach

  • Point out what I might be doing wrong

  • Explain the correct way to persist item data in a RAP-managed scenario

  • Share best practices for Excel upload + RAP persistence

I will paste all relevant code (CDS, Behavior Definition, and Class Implementation) below for reference.

Thank you very much in advance for your support.

Please paste your Code recommendation if possible.

Environment:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Extensibility 
RAP (Managed with Draft)

entry.title: S4HC Public Crosscompany Flow CO Issue (Margin analysis by customer not available at group level)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are implementing S4HC Public to a Industrial Food company. They have a manufacturing company (2000) and a trading company (3000). They have a crosscompany process, in which the shipment is done from 2000 and the billing from 3000, so there is an internal billing with a margin because of legal transfer price requirements. Once the flow is done and the accounting documents are registered, the analytical PL by company code is shown in the screenshot attached. 

The problem we find is that the customer filled in the PSG of the expense registered in 3000 (internal billing) is the final customer instead of the group customer (3000), whereas the COGS from the shipment from 2000 has the group customer (3000) instead of the final customer. This standard behaviour of the system prevents the client to analyze the actual margin by customer at group level skipping the internal billing, since the revenue is allocated to the final customer in the PSG, but the COGS from the shipment is allocated to the group customer (3000).

- Implementing transfer pricing is not an option.

- Changing the invoice type from INVOICE02 to INVOICE01 in the IDOC, so that internal billing expense is allocated to the group customer (3000) in the PSG is not allowed in S4HC Public.

- PSG derivation customizing point (which would resolve our problem, since we could change the customer in the PSG according to many conditions and rules) is not available in S4HC Public. Instead we have a very limited app (Manage Substitution and Validation Rules) in which, for the Margin Analysis context, we only have available PSG characteristics as conditions (which are not useful for this case) and fields like gl account or movement type (needed for doing the derivation correctly) are not available.

WHAT CAN WE DO? Is there any custom logic we can use for an "advanced PSG characteristic sustitution"? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: S4HC Public Crosscompany CO Issue (Margin Analysis by customer at group level not allowed)
entry.content:
Hi experts,

We are implementing S4HC Public to a Industrial Food company. They have a manufacturing company (2000) and a trading company (3000). They have a crosscompany process, in which the shipment is done from 2000 and the billing from 3000, so there is an internal billing with a margin because of legal transfer price requirements. Once the flow is done and the accounting documents are registered, the analytical PL by company code is shown in the screenshot attached. 

The problem we find is that the customer filled in the PSG of the expense registered in 3000 (internal billing) is the final customer instead of the group customer (3000), whereas the COGS from the shipment from 2000 has the group customer (3000) instead of the final customer. This standard behaviour of the system prevents the client to analyze the actual margin by customer at group level skipping the internal billing, since the revenue is allocated to the final customer in the PSG, but the COGS from the shipment is allocated to the group customer (3000).

- Implementing transfer pricing is not an option.

- Changing the invoice type from INVOICE02 to INVOICE01 in the IDOC, so that internal billing expense is allocated to the group customer (3000) in the PSG is not allowed in S4HC Public.

- PSG derivation customizing point (which would resolve our problem, since we could change the customer in the PSG according to many conditions and rules) is not available in S4HC Public. Instead we have a very limited app (Manage Substitution and Validation Rules) in which, for the Margin Analysis context, we only have available PSG characteristics as conditions (which are not useful for this case) and fields like gl account or movement type (needed for doing the derivation correctly) are not available.

WHAT CAN WE DO? Is there any custom logic we can use for an "advanced PSG characteristic sustitution"? 

Thanks. Regards,

entry.title: Sales Price Rounding Issue S4 HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have a customer requirement Regard to rounding off Price in S4 HANA Public cloud as given below:

Product Selling Price = Base Price * Margin

Base Price (ZPR0) at Material level = Rs. 9.94/KG

Selling Margin at Product Group Level (ZPRM) = 5%

As per Standard Calculation:

Consider order Quantity = 3500

Condition Value (ZPR0) = 3500*9.94 = Rs. 34,790.00

Condition Value (ZPRM) = 34790*0.05 = 1739.50

Gross Condition Value = 34790+1739.50 = 36529.50

Gross Condition Amount = 36529.50/3500 = 10.437 = 10.44 (Round off 2 decimal)

Business Requirement:

Gross Condition Amount = 9.94+(9.94*5%) = 10.44 (Round off 2 decimal)

Gross Condition Value = 10.44 * 3500 = Rs. 36,540

We have achieved business requirement using pricing routine (Extension Point: PRCG_DOC_ITEM_CONDITION_AMOUNT) for the Gross amount to override the standard calculation. But subsequent calculation for additional conditions, Tax calculation and Final Net Value it is still considering the Gross Amount from standard calculation. Any suggestion to address this?

entry.title: Stock Transfer Order between plants in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud – Confirmation control Key
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I am configuring a stock transfer order between plants in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Both plants are WM-managed warehouses, and the process requires moving Handling Unit (HU) numbers from one warehouse to another.

While reviewing the Implementation Activities, I cannot find any configuration point where it is possible to define a confirmation control key per document type, similar to what exists in on-premise systems under Define Order Confirmation for Delivery.

In the Plant related Business Partner settings , I have maintained the confirmation key as Inbound Delivery (0004). However, when creating a stock transfer order in ME21N with document type UB, the confirmation field is still empty.

Does anyone know:

  • Where this can be configured in Public Cloud?

  • Or if it is even possible to default the confirmation control key to Inbound Delivery for stock transfer orders?

Any guidance or confirmation of limitations in Public Cloud would be appreciated. I've checked sap note 2436023, and it not apply to Public.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: F4 Value Help for Step Condition in Flexible Workflow – SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I am working on SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (Public Edition) and trying to add F4 / Value Help for a custom parameter (Purchase Group) in a Flexible Workflow step condition.

Requirement

  • Add a custom step condition in Flexible Workflow

  • Enable F4 value help for the condition parameter

  • Values should come from a custom source (CDS / OData)

What I Have Tried So Far

  1. Implemented the Flexible Workflow BAdI

    • IF_SWF_FLEX_IFS_CONDITION_DEF

    • Defined custom condition and parameter successfully

    • The condition appears correctly in the workflow configuration

  2. Tried using a Custom CDS View (Value Help type)

    • Created CDS view with required fields

    • Enabled it as a Value Help

    • CDS activates successfully

  3. Attempted to connect CDS via OData

    • Created OData service for the CDS

    • Tried to consume this OData in the BAdI for value help

❗ Issue:
At the final step, when trying to use the OData service inside the BAdI, the OData is not working / not accessible in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

Because of this:

  • F4 help is not appearing in the workflow step condition

  • I am unable to bind CDS/OData as a value help source

My Questions

  1. Is it technically supported to provide F4 value help for Flexible Workflow step conditions in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

  2. Is there any approved way to consume CDS or OData for value help in this scenario?

  3. If this is a known limitation, is there any recommended workaround?

Any guidance or confirmation would be highly appreciated.

Thank you in advance.

Best Regards,
Jeet Kanabar

entry.title: Tax Card data for Qatar region
entry.content:
Dear experts,

When I try to create Supplier with Country/Region Outside Qatar, the system asks to Maintain the Tax Card data, so i should maintain the Tax card details as Resident or Non - Resident, when i maintain as Non - resident system asks to enter the Withholding tax details for the Supplier, but when i maintain as Resident system allows to Save the Supplier. But to my understanding Supplier outside the Qatar should maintained as Non - Resident. In this case can anyone guide me how to resolve this or there any option to remove the Validation that's asking for tax card details for the Supplier master which is maintained the Country of origin outside Qatar. 

Best regards,

Dinesh U

entry.title: stop multiple proforma invoices against single delivery document
entry.content:
Dear Team,

As per the business requirement, validations with appropriate error messages are required during proforma invoice creation (Document Type – F8):

  1. Restrict the creation of multiple proforma invoices against a single delivery document.

  2. Do not allow proforma invoice creation without PGI (Post Goods Issue).

Kindly suggest the appropriate process or BAdI to implement these validations.

entry.title: #COE#RFL01 - Error during partial settlement of investment project with migrate asset
entry.content:
Hello,

We have a error when we try to partial capitalize an investment project on an asset we create with the migration cockpit.
We don't have this issue when we partial capitalize an investment project on an asset create manually.

The error is : Fixed asset XXX : Transfer at year end occurs w/o transfer of transactions, message class FAA_POST, Message Number 515

Actually the only difference I see between this two case is about the field :
- Capitalization Date of Original Asset
- Legacy Transfer Date

There are some restrictions or prerequisite with these previous fields ?
Have you some advises about the error message ?

Yours sincerely,

Teddy.

entry.title: Corrective invoice template (Poland)
entry.content:
We do the roll-out of S4 Hana public cloud in Poland

We use the process for corrective invoice (document type RK) for customers. In this specific flow we have the initial invoice items (item category G2N) and the correction items (item category L2N)

On the billing document output (PDF template) we would like to have a split in item to clearly mention the initial items and then the corrected one. This is a common practice in Poland. In the item section the invoice should look like this :

Before correction

item frame with initial items (G2N)

After correction

item frame with corrected items (L2N)

The requirement is basically to split the item frame in 2 sub item frame (by item category) and add a title to each sub frame

But we can't design the template as such. Can you advice how to do ?

Thanks
